Reviews.Title: “Dependable Courtyard by Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Triaero
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would expect: clean, friendly, good rates. Doesn't have that ridiculous new decorating scheme or stupid coffee bar that many of the Courtyards have. wish they were all this good.

Reviews.Title: “Rare, superior customer service!”
Reviews.Author: anyaMunster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were part of a large wedding party staying at this property. Location: right off I-17. IHOP in walking distance. Restaurants and a huge Wal-Mart a mile away. Loved Mellow Mushroom for grinders, pizzas, pitas... Check-in: easy. Rooms: modern, nice furniture, large TV, wireless service. Only 60 rooms have a small fridge, so if you need one, ask for it in advance. Workout room: small. 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals and free weights Pool: shared with neighboring hotel. Whirlpool. Chaise lounges have cushions (they need to be replaced), however, pool towels are accessible at the pool gate and will cover the cushions. If bringing beer, I would recommend cans and not glass. The front desk asked if the beer in my hand (glass) was from the pool...of course I said No. :) Smaller basketball court~basketball available at front desk. Bar: Opens at 5pm. No food available. Breakfast: not complimentary. Nice service though here! Buffet includes, eggs, bacon, oatmeal with fresh berries, waffle station, bagels, juices. Again, the customer service from every staff member was wonderful! Thank you, Grace, for all your efforts in finding out how much it would cost to clean my dress. The front desk called me to let me know the price FIRST and to see if I still wanted to have the dress pressed via their laundry service. So thoughtful to check with me first! And the front desk staff was always smiling!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Time At The Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: cstoutMn
Reviews.Content: Stay here for my son's baseball tournament. The hotelmis very new with a nice heated pool,jacuzzi and sport court. We had breakfast included with our room. The staff here was great and house keeping did a awesome job. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing marriot courtyard”
Reviews.Author: sandie2009
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and each time I am blown away at how great the staff is! They really try to even call you by name! It is a great hotel for Business travelers and I would highly recommend it! They will not say no to any request! They even have a box of phone chargers behind the desk that you can borrow. Ask for Samantha at night! She is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Comfortable Night”
Reviews.Author: dsg560
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our way to California. Room was VERY clean and comfy. We would recommend! Good stores and restaurants nearby. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great short vacation”
Reviews.Author: saptraveler_21
Reviews.Content: I want thank everyone at the hotel for making this short vacation a very nice one. From the receptionist to the general manger. Everyone here is very profesional and they treat you like you are part of their family. The breakfast was excellent. You have your choice to ask for eggs your way!!!! Beds were super comfortable. I wanted a small refrigerator in the room, and the staff told me that if it was available they could get me one, and they did. This hotel and the residence inn which is next door are fantastic!! The entire stay was superb and the price was also fenomenal. I would highly recomend anyone to stay at the Courtyard Phoenix North / Happy Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Phoenix North is good for travelers to the area”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard Phoenix North/Happy Valley for 2 nights in March 2011. I was traveling all over the Phoenix area, so I needed a nice, clean hotel not far off the interstate. This was exactly what I needed. I normally don't stay in suburban areas like this, but like I said I was traveling all over and wasn't at my hotel much beyond sleeping and eating breakfast. The hotel was very clean, the free breakfast was good (for what it is), and the staff was nice. My room overlooked the pool area (which I didn't use), so it got a little noisy at some points. While this wasn't enough to bother me, you might want to request a room not facing the pool if you think it would be an issue for you. There's just about every chain restaurant you can think of in the immediate area (again, this isn't something I normally look for), but if you want to go more intown it's maybe a 20 minute drive -- not bad. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first night of our AZ vacation. The hotel was everything we needed. It is easy to get to from the Phoenix airport, less than an hour and a good starting point to head to the north area (Sedona & Grand Canyon) the following day. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. The extra blanket we requested was delivered within minutes. It is in a retail area with a Walmart very close to stock up for the drive north. It is not in a vacation destination area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: t-m-c-m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after visitng friends in Anthem. Used our Marriott points so it didn't cost us anything. We found the location good with plenty of shops nearby. Our room was modern and large, very clean and the shower was great! - one of the best ones we found during our trip! Great large LCD TV along with a sofabed sitting area. Bed was very comfortable. Internet was very fast. Didn't sample the breakfast so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastTravels034
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard on business. While it seems like a little further out it worked for my business trip. The front desk was very helpful and kind. I had a little quiet room (and the hotel was sold out). Great room - nice tv, big bathroom, microware, mini fridge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for our entire family”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC-CA
Reviews.Content: My family with young children stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and had zero problems. The service staff was helpful and always asked if we needed anything. We requested two cribs for our room and they were already set up when we got there a long with extra sheets and pillows.The room was very clean and everything is still new. We were in town for Spring Training, so it was a little farther drive since it's on the north side of Phoenix. The extra drive was worth it because the surrounding area was very nice and safe. All new chain stores and restaurants nearby. Made our family feel very comfortable and had everything we needed nearby. A nice sized heated pool and spa that is shared with the Marriott Residence Inn next door, perfect for our entire family. Bed was very comfortable and shower was perfect. They had an all you can eat breakfast bar for $9.50 per adult. All kids under 12 were free when with an adult. Not the greatest food, but definitely did the job on days we wanted the convenience. Make your own waffles, cook to order eggs and all the other normal breakfast buffet items. Air conditioning worked well. Free wireless and wired internet worked great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. Will also look forward to staying here again if we come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend to attend a Nascar race and NFL football game.The hotel itself is about a 20 minute drive from the airport and about the same to the U of Phoenix stadium area, not a problem as the road/freeways are very easy to navigate around the Phoenix area.This hotel is fairly new and easy to find in an area that is new(office buldings,stores,restautants,hotels).The room was clean and modern by hotel standards.The staff seemed friendly whenever we crossed paths. I would recommend this hotel to anyone,don't be scared off because its a little further away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Marriott was great!”
Reviews.Author: colbran
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Happy Valley/Phoenix this past week. It's about 1 mile at most from the interstate (I-17), so there was no traffic noise at all. The Courtyard is separated from the Residence Marriott by the swimming pool and basketball court. The pool is bigger than normal because both of the hotels use it. The beds and bedding are phenomenal in the Marriotts, in case you haven't stayed in one for awhile. The room was plenty big for the four of us (2 adults, 2 kids over 10), pool was great for the kids, and they had a basketball court/tennis court as well. We had wireless internet in our room, as well as HD flat screen with plenty of channels. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful; above and beyond really. The drawback would be no continental/free breakfast, but there was a small restaurant on-site. I believe breakfast was $9.95. Clearly the fact that no breakfast or meal was included didn't make us not want to stay there....that was a choice we made. That said, there were plenty of places around the hotel, particularly a brand new Paradise Bakery & Cafe in Norterra just about 2 minutes from the Courtyard. This is an area that seems to be relatively new and is going to be growing. The Norterra at this point has very few shops open, but no doubt within 6 months, it will be completely full. We stayed at this Courtyard for $180.00 per night during spring break time, and I booked using AAA on the Marriott.com website. That's a little steep, as there was a Fairfield Marriott down south about 5 miles that had a nightly rate of $151.00 and included a free breakfast, but we stayed there last year and we wanted to try somewhere new. I think if the price was right next year, we'd opt to either stay here again or right next door at the Residence. I don't think you could go wrong with either of them.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Phoenix North / Happy Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 2029 Whispering Wind Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85085
